question.title: Spring Cloud Config Server tries to fetch configuration from itself(not-intentionally)
question.body:
Some of the modules fetch configuration correctly without a problem. But when some other modules try it config server itself starts to fetch config from localhost:8888 which is its own port and naturally couldn't connect to it so it crashes.Here is application.properties of config server:

spring.application.name=cloud_config
server.port=8888

#LOCAL
spring.profiles.active=native
spring.cloud.config.server.native.search-locations=${PATH_TO_CONFIG:file:///D:/config-repo}

spring.cloud.config.server.git.clone-on-start=true
spring.cloud.config.server.git.basedir=C:/tmp/config-repo

this is what logs show on config server:

Fetching config from server at : http://localhost:8888
Fetching config from server at : http://localhost:8888
Fetching config from server at : http://localhost:8888

all clients have similar dependencies and properties so i don't think problem is in there and config server doesn't have spring-cloud-starter-config dependency. Just config server. I double checked properties, @EnableConfigServer, and dependencies so I am stuck.

question_comments.body: I found the problem. Apparantly you can't put these inside {application-name}.properties: spring.config.import=optional:configserver:http://localhost:‌​8888 spring.cloud.config.fail-fast=true you need to put these only on application.properties of module. When I copy pasted these properties were included so when config server fetched them it accidently tried refetch from 8888.
